column4: erg, maybe I shouldn't be using Ubuntu if I can't even figure out how to configure my wireless adapter.  I'll try again later.
Maximilian  would you mind helping me when you are done?
Chibipanda the netgear wg311v3,  I get "FATAL: module ndiswrapper not found" after "sudo modprobe ndiswrapper"
ndiswrapper -l displays that my drivers are installed
Yes I installed ndiswrapper, and apt-get isn't going to work because I'm not online
is this 12.04? ndiswrapper isn't included with the kernel in 12.04 so you need to install ndiswrapper-dkms
yes! How do I install ndiswrapper-dkms?
sudo apt-get install ndiswrapper-dkms; although if you only have wireless, you'll need to download the package from packages.ubuntu.com and install it manually
when I tried installing ndiswrapper-dkms it says package dkms not installed
yes you'll need dkms too (you also need the two linux-headers packages, I wasn't sure if either of those were installed by default)
where do I download those? Are they deb files?
can you pastebin: dpkg -l 'linux-headers*'; and you can download all the packages from packages.ubuntu.com
http://packages.ubuntu.com/precise/dkms for instance
I cannot pastebin as I'm not online but I should install all those?  Also how do I install dkms it isnt a deb file
at the bottom of that page, the all link, goes to: http://packages.ubuntu.com/precise/all/dkms/download where you can download it
don't really need the pastebin I was just curious if the headers were already installed, what is: uname -a; I'll grab the correct links to the headers
-pae?
got it
http://packages.ubuntu.com/precise/linux-headers-3.2.0-23-generic-pae and http://packages.ubuntu.com/precise/linux-headers-3.2.0-23
I believe those 4 packages should be enough for dkms to build the module
no problem, good luck with the install
excellent!
